subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit Failure Trace not printed completely
msgSnippet: ... Since no fail method is invoked, the test will pass if an exception occurs.  You ll have to check the output to see the error. Not very useful in a nightly
messageBody:
> public void testXyz()
> {
> try
> {
> // a exception occurs
> }
> catch(Exception e)
> {
> e.printStackTrace();
> }
> }

Since no fail method is invoked, the test will pass if an exception
occurs. You'll have to check the output to see the error.

Not very useful in a nightly build.

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir R. Bossicard
